overview:
Esten Hurtle is a web developer focused on building rich, cross-platform webapps using the latest in open-source technology. Focusing primarily on backend development in Python (with experience in both the Tornado and Django frameworks), he has built applications for everything from open-source projects to enterprise-class systems on the University of Missouri campus. While Python is his specialty, Esten also has considerable experience in PHP.

In addition to backend work, Esten is also an experienced front-end developer, working with AJAX and JavaScript to ensure a seamless user experience across multiple platforms. In 2010, Esten was the front-end developer for a winning team in the Interaction Design contest sponsored by Adobe, the Reynolds Journalism Institute at the University of Missouri, and Hearst Innovation.

Currently, he is working as a developer for LearningWeb, an e-learning startup based in Columbia, MO.

external_links.title: Hearst Corporation, Reynolds Journalism Institute and Adobe Announce Winners of Student Interactive Design Competition
